channel.title: 2 Very Small Issues

item.title: 2 Very Small Issues
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Soulxs, post:2, topic:553871”]Change the variable name, lol.
After you changed it remember to change it in the code ( dont know how else to call it) aswell. Try that, if you don’t understand tell me i’ll get back to you when i have time. Im on my mobile now[/quote]
This.
To clarify:
Your issue is because you already have a variable defined in the scope.
The problem with switch statements is, if you define a variable within it, it can’t be defined again.
Example of your error:

int anInt = 0; switch (anInt) { case 0: String aString = "My string"; System.out.println(myString); break; case 1: String aString = "I cause errors!"; System.out.println(myString); break; }
The variable “aString” is defined two times in the switch, and therefore will cause an error.

What you can do to prevent this is:
A) rename the variable you accidentally redefined (A.K.A, where the error is coming from). When you do this make sure that you also change where the variable is used (in your case, the for loop underneath it).

B) Declare the variable before the switch statement, then reuse it where needed. This can work depending on what you’re doing. For instance, defining a player object before a switch instead of literally every case…

Those are probably your best two options in the matter.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Very Small Issues
item.dc:creator: @bangbangzz bangbangzz
item.description:
@bangbangzz wrote:

[font=arial black]I’ve got me a little issue here. Im using the xisthpk source, and its been pretty nice to me so far.[/font]
[font=arial black]Basically, I started with making the pre-set “brid” button, equip all of the armor in the code, while it used to just put it in the invy.
now, i have this class labeled “hybrid”. I also have 3 more classes to make, MELEE RANGE nd MAGE. But when i try to use the same int code on the other classes, i get a variable is already defined in method process packet error[/font]

Ive done some research, and figured out I couldnt use the same variable name twice… But I’m not the most experienced coder. I dont expect spoonfeeds to me, more than a few pointers.
Been in the mopar community since 07’ crazy to think it’s still booming. Anyways, much appreciated guys!
Here are the 2 cases, they are right on top of each other.

[code]case 28169: //hybrid

		int[] equip = { 10828, 2412, 6585, 4675, 4712, 6889, -1, 4714, -1,
				7462, 6920, -1, 6737, 9244 };
		for (int i = 0; i < equip.length; i++) {
			c.playerEquipment[i] = equip[i];
			c.playerEquipmentN[i] = 1;
			c.getItems().setEquipment(equip[i], 1, i);
		}
			c.getItems().addItem(555, 1200);
			c.getItems().addItem(560, 800);
			c.getItems().addItem(565, 400);
			c.getItems().addItem(4736, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(11724, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(11726, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(11732, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(5698, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(2436, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(2440, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(6685, 2);
			c.getItems().addItem(10925, 2);
			c.getItems().addItem(555, 5000);
			c.getItems().addItem(565, 5000);
			c.getItems().addItem(560, 5000);
			c.getItems().addItem(15055, 11);
			c.getItems().addItem(8850, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(4151, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(6570, 13);
			c.playerMagicBook = 1;
			c.sendMessage("Rob ftw.");
			c.getItems().resetItems(3214);
			c.getItems().resetBonus();
			c.getItems().getBonus();
			c.getItems().writeBonus();
			c.updateRequired = true;
			c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;


			break;
	
		case 28175: //melee

			
		
		int[] equip = { 10828, 2412, 6585, 4675, 4712, 6889, -1, 4714, -1,
				7462, 6920, -1, 6737, 9244 };
		for (int i = 0; i < equip.length; i++) {
			c.playerEquipment[i] = equip[i];
			c.playerEquipmentN[i] = 1;
			c.getItems().setEquipment(equip[i], 1, i);
		}
			c.getItems().addItem(555, 1200);
			c.getItems().addItem(560, 800);
			c.getItems().addItem(565, 400);
			c.getItems().addItem(4736, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(11724, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(11726, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(11732, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(5698, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(2436, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(2440, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(6685, 2);
			c.getItems().addItem(10925, 2);
			c.getItems().addItem(555, 5000);
			c.getItems().addItem(565, 5000);
			c.getItems().addItem(560, 5000);
			c.getItems().addItem(15055, 11);
			c.getItems().addItem(8850, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(4151, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(6570, 13);
			c.playerMagicBook = 1;
			c.sendMessage("Rob ftw.");
			c.getItems().resetItems(3214);
			c.getItems().resetBonus();
			c.getItems().getBonus();
			c.getItems().writeBonus();
			c.updateRequired = true;
			c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

break;[/code]
[size=12pt]COMPILER ERROR[/size]

src\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:526: error: variable equip is already defined in method processPacket(Client,int,int) int[] equip = { 10828, 2412, 6585, 4675, 4712, 6889, -1, 4714, -1, ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
